Type.Name: TripleDESCryptoServiceProvider
Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the <link location="node:gtk-sharp/programming/threads">Gtk# Thread Programming</link> for details.

Docs.summary: Managed implementation of the Triple Data Encryption Standard (3DES), a 192 bits (168 bits effective) symmetric cipher.
Docs.remarks: In Mono this class is completely implemented in managed code.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Security.Cryptography.ICryptoTransform CreateDecryptor (byte[] rgbKey, byte[] rgbIV);

Docs.param: Secret key to be used for the decryption transform.
Initialization Vector (IV) to be used by the decryption transform.
Docs.summary: Creates a symmetric TripleDES decryptor transform.
Docs.returns: a that is ready to be used to decrypt data.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Security.Cryptography.ICryptoTransform CreateEncryptor (byte[] rgbKey, byte[] rgbIV);

Docs.param: Secret key to be used for the encryption transform.
Initialization Vector (IV) to be used by the encryption transform.
Docs.summary: Creates a symmetric TripleDES encryptor transform.
Docs.returns: a that is ready to be used to encrypt data.

Docs.summary: Generate a new random Initialization Vector (IV) required for some block cipher modes.

remarks.para: The IV is used for most of operation (except ). The value can be made public and must be available when decrypting the data.
IMPORTANT: If you reuse the same TripleDES object for multiple encryption using the same key it is CAPITAL that you use a different IV each time.
